Module com.ning.breakout
Package com.ning.breakout.view.graphics

Class Paddle

java.lang.Object
com.ning.breakout.view.graphics.Paddle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Movable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RubberPaddle
public abstract class Paddle extends Object implements Movable
Paddle is the abstract base class for all paddle classes which defines the common attributes and behaviors of all paddle classes.

The layout of the view of the paddle binds with the model of the paddle, every time the paddle moves, the layout of the view of the paddle will also be updated. By adding the view of the paddle into container, the paddle could be displayed onto the stage.

By extending the abstract class paddle, sub-classes could have various width and height, and the different source images of their views.

Author:
Ning ZHU - modified

  • Constructor Details

    • Paddle

      public Paddle(PaddleModel model, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle boundary, javafx.scene.Group container)
      The class constructor sets the model and the moving boundary of the paddle, binds the layout of the view of the paddle with the model and adds the view to the container. 
       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public Paddle(Point ballPoint, int width, int height,
  Rectangle container) {
      this.ballPoint = ballPoint;
      moveAmount = 0;
      paddleFace = makeRectangle(width, height);
      min = container.x + (width / 2);
      max = min + container.width - width;
  }
      Parameters:
      model - the model of paddle
      boundary - the moving boundary of the paddle
      container - the container of paddle's view
      See Also:
      • PaddleModel
      • Rectangle
      • Group

  • Method Details

    • getPaddleView

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getPaddleView()
      Returns the view of the paddle.

      The layout of the ImageView object binds with the model of the paddle. By setting the source image of the ImageView object and adding it to the container, different paddles can be displayed onto the stage.

      Returns:
      the view of the paddle
      See Also:
      • ImageView

    • move

      public void move()
      Moves the paddle by speed and updates the layout of paddle's view.

      Checks whether the paddle will move out of the boundary at first. The movement will be canceled if the paddle will move out of the boundary. When paddle moves within in the boundary, the top-center point of the paddle will firstly be moved and then the layout of the view of the paddle will be updated. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void move(){
      double x = ballPoint.getX() + moveAmount;
      if(x < min || x > max)
          return;
      ballPoint.setLocation(x,ballPoint.getY());
      paddleFace.setLocation(ballPoint.x - (int) paddleFace.getWidth()/2,
          ballPoint.y);
  }
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable
      See Also:
      • Movable.move()

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(javafx.geometry.Point2D point)
      Moves the paddle to specified position and updates the layout of paddle's view.

      The top-center point of the paddle will firstly be moved to the specified point, then the layout of the view of the paddle will be updated.

      Usually used to recover paddle's position when ball is lost. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void moveTo(Point p){
      ballPoint.setLocation(p);
      paddleFace.setLocation(ballPoint.x - (int) paddleFace.getWidth()/2,
          ballPoint.y);
  }
      Specified by:
      moveTo in interface Movable
      Parameters:
      point - the position the top-center point of the paddle will move to
      See Also:
      • Movable.moveTo(Point2D)

    • impact

      public boolean impact(Ball ball)
      Checks if the ball impacts the paddle.

      Returns true only if both the center point and the down point of the ball within the paddle, otherwise false. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public boolean impact(Ball b){
      return paddleFace.contains(b.getPosition())
              && paddleFace.contains(b.down);
  }
      Parameters:
      ball - the instance of class Ball
      Returns:
      true if the ball impacts the paddle
      See Also:
      • Ball
